$eref.description: The Topic Properties definition.

___enablePartitioning.description: Value that indicates whether the topic to be partitioned across multiple message brokers is enabled.

___enableExpress.description: Value that indicates whether Express Entities are enabled. An express topic holds a message in memory temporarily before writing it to persistent storage.

___enableBatchedOperations.description: Value that indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.

___status.description: Enumerates the possible values for the status of a messaging entity.

___requiresDuplicateDetection.description: Value indicating if this topic requires duplicate detection.

___defaultMessageTimeToLive.description: ISO 8601 Default message timespan to live value. This is the duration after which the message expires, starting from when the message is sent to Service Bus. This is the default value used when TimeToLive is not set on a message itself.

___supportOrdering.description: Value that indicates whether the topic supports ordering.

___duplicateDetectionHistoryTimeWindow.description: ISO8601 timespan structure that defines the duration of the duplicate detection history. The default value is 10 minutes.

___autoDeleteOnIdle.description: ISO 8601 timespan idle interval after which the topic is automatically deleted. The minimum duration is 5 minutes.

___maxSizeInMegabytes.description: Maximum size of the topic in megabytes, which is the size of the memory allocated for the topic. Default is 1024.

$eref.description: Deployment template expression. See https://aka.ms/arm-template-expressions for more details on the ARM expression syntax.
Microsoft.ServiceBus/namespaces/topics/authorizationRules
Microsoft.ServiceBus/namespaces/topics/subscriptions
The Queue Properties definition.

___deadLetteringOnMessageExpiration.description: A value that indicates whether this queue has dead letter support when a message expires.

___enableExpress.description: A value that indicates whether Express Entities are enabled. An express queue holds a message in memory temporarily before writing it to persistent storage.

___enableBatchedOperations.description: Value that indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.

___status.description: Enumerates the possible values for the status of a messaging entity.

___requiresDuplicateDetection.description: A value indicating if this queue requires duplicate detection.

___duplicateDetectionHistoryTimeWindow.description: ISO 8601 timeSpan structure that defines the duration of the duplicate detection history. The default value is 10 minutes.

___autoDeleteOnIdle.description: ISO 8061 timeSpan idle interval after which the queue is automatically deleted. The minimum duration is 5 minutes.

___lockDuration.description: ISO 8601 timespan duration of a peek-lock; that is, the amount of time that the message is locked for other receivers. The maximum value for LockDuration is 5 minutes; the default value is 1 minute.

___forwardDeadLetteredMessagesTo.description: Queue/Topic name to forward the Dead Letter message

___maxSizeInMegabytes.description: The maximum size of the queue in megabytes, which is the size of memory allocated for the queue. Default is 1024.

___enablePartitioning.description: A value that indicates whether the queue is to be partitioned across multiple message brokers.

___requiresSession.description: A value that indicates whether the queue supports the concept of sessions.

___forwardTo.description: Queue/Topic name to forward the messages

___defaultMessageTimeToLive.description: ISO 8601 default message timespan to live value. This is the duration after which the message expires, starting from when the message is sent to Service Bus. This is the default value used when TimeToLive is not set on a message itself.

___maxDeliveryCount.description: The maximum delivery count. A message is automatically deadlettered after this number of deliveries. default value is 10.

___deadLetteringOnMessageExpiration.description: Value that indicates whether a subscription has dead letter support when a message expires.

___requiresSession.description: Value indicating if a subscription supports the concept of sessions.

___enableBatchedOperations.description: Value that indicates whether server-side batched operations are enabled.

___status.description: Enumerates the possible values for the status of a messaging entity.

___forwardTo.description: Queue/Topic name to forward the messages

___defaultMessageTimeToLive.description: ISO 8061 Default message timespan to live value. This is the duration after which the message expires, starting from when the message is sent to Service Bus. This is the default value used when TimeToLive is not set on a message itself.

___duplicateDetectionHistoryTimeWindow.description: ISO 8601 timeSpan structure that defines the duration of the duplicate detection history. The default value is 10 minutes.

___autoDeleteOnIdle.description: ISO 8061 timeSpan idle interval after which the topic is automatically deleted. The minimum duration is 5 minutes.

___lockDuration.description: ISO 8061 lock duration timespan for the subscription. The default value is 1 minute.

___forwardDeadLetteredMessagesTo.description: Queue/Topic name to forward the Dead Letter message

___deadLetteringOnFilterEvaluationExcept.description: Value that indicates whether a subscription has dead letter support on filter evaluation exceptions.
